API docs by Redocly

NodeBB Write API (3.0.0)

Download OpenAPI specification:

E-mail: support@nodebb.org License: GPL-3.0

Overview

The following document outlines every route exposed by the NodeBB Write API. Since NodeBB v1.15.0, NodeBB has used these routes to make changes to the database (e.g. creating new posts, editing user profiles, etc.) We invite you to build external integrations with NodeBB using this document as a guide.

History

Up until v1.15.0, NodeBB utilised the WebSocket protocol to communicate with the backend. However, it was decided in early 2020 that this usage of WebSocket — while functional — led to occasional wheel reinvention and disregarded an otherwise fully-featured technology (that is, REST). Years prior to this determination, many users of NodeBB had asked for a RESTful API to call against NodeBB, which led to the creation of nodebb-plugin-write-api. In tandem with the above decision, the Write API was merged into NodeBB core in late 2020. v3 of the Write API (this document) supercedes v2 of the Write API plugin, and is currently maintained.

Authentication

Similarly to the Read API, the Write API support both session-based (cookie) and Bearer token authentication. Please see the "Authentication" section under the Read API for more information on how to authenticate against this API in order to make calls.

utilities

Utility calls to test Write API functionality

test route

This route responds with a simple 200 OK if the Write API is enabled. Since there is no way of disabling the Write API, this will always return a success. However, it is also a good way to ensure the instance you are calling supports v3 of the Write API.

Responses

/api/v3/ping

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "status": {
    • "code": "ok",
    • "message": "OK"
    },
  • "response": {
    • "pong": true
    }
}

test route

Requires authentication. This route bounces back the data payload sent to it, and the uid the token resolved to.

It is also a good way to ensure the instance you are calling supports v3 of the Write API. Also, as it requires authentication, it is a good way to check if the passed-in token is a valid token.

Request Body schema: application/json
optional
property name*
additional property
any

Responses

/api/v3/ping

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "property1": null,
  • "property2": null
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "status": {
    • "code": "ok",
    • "message": "OK"
    },
  • "response": {
    • "uid": 0,
    • "received": {
      • "property1": null,
      • "property2": null
      }
    }
}

verify login credentials

This route accepts a username/password or email/password pair (dependent on forum settings), returning a standard user object if credentials are validated successfully. This route also initializes a standard login session and returns a valid cookie that can be used in subsequent API calls as though it were a browser session. Note: Cookie-based sessions require a CSRF token for non-GET routes.

Request Body schema: application/json
username
string
password
string

Responses

/api/v3/utilities/login

Content type
application/json
{
  • "username": "admin",
  • "password": "123456"
}

generate a user token

This route can only be used to generate tokens for the same user. In other words, you cannot use this route to generate a token for a different user than the one you are authenticated as.

path Parameters
uid
required
integer
Example: 1

uid of the user to generate a token for

Responses

/api/v3/users/{uid}/tokens

Response samples

  • 200
Content type

get user emails

This operation lists all emails associated with the user. This route is accessible to all users if the target user has elected to show their email publicly. Otherwise, it is only accessible to privileged users, or if the calling user is the same as the target user.

path Parameters
uid
required
number
Example: 1

A valid user id

Responses

/api/v3/users/{uid}/emails

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "status": {
    • "code": "ok",
    • "message": "OK"
    },
  • "response": {
    • "emails": [
      • "string"
      ]
    }
}

add email to user

This operation adds an email to the user account, optionally bypassing the confirmation step if requested.

Note: The confirmation bypass can only be called by super administrators or users with the admin:users privilege.

path Parameters
uid
required
integer
Example: 1

uid of the account to add the email

Request Body schema: application/json
required
email
required
string

A single email address

skipConfirmation
boolean

If truthy, will automatically confirm the user's email.

Responses

/api/v3/users/{uid}/emails

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "email": "test@example.org",
  • "skipConfirmation": 1
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "status": {
    • "code": "ok",
    • "message": "OK"
    },
  • "response": {
    • "emails": [
      • "string"
      ]
    }
}

get user's email data

This operation lists the data associated with a single email. This route is accessible to all users if the target user has elected to show their email publicly. Otherwise, it is only accessible to privileged users, or if the calling user is the same as the target user.

path Parameters

required
number
Example: 1

A valid user id

email
required
string
Example: test@example.org

A valid email address

Responses

/api/v3/users/{uid}/emails/{email}

validate a user's email address

Marks the passed-in user's email as confirmed. This route is only accessible to administrators with the admin:users privilege (or superadmins)

The type of export to download

Responses

Generate a user export

This operation generates a user export file for later download. It will return immediately with the 202 Accepted response code, meaning the request was accepted for processing. The expected behaviour is for the client to then poll the corresponding HEAD method until it returns a 204 No Content (or if awaiting a new export, for the Last-Modified or ETag header to change) at which point the GET method can be called for download.

path Parameters
uid
required
integer
Example: 1

uid of the user to make the query for

type
required
string
Example: posts

The type of export to download

Responses

/api/v3/users/{uid}/exports/{type}

Response samples

  • 202
Content type
application/json
{
  • "status": {
    • "code": "ok",
    • "message": "OK"
    },
  • "response": { }
}

groups

Calls related to user groups

list groups

This operation returns a list of user groups. The number of groups returned is hardcoded to 15 per page.

query Parameters
page
number
Example: page=1

Used for pagination

sort
string
Enum: "date" "count"
Example: sort=date

Changes how the returned groups are sorted. By default, will return groups in alphanumeric order.

Responses

/api/v3/groups/

list group members

This operation returns a list of members in a user groups. Group owners (if any) are floated to the top of the returned users.

path Parameters
slug
required
string
Example: administrators

a group slug (that also acts as its identifier)

query Parameters
query
string
Example: query=a

A keyword search query. This parameter conflicts with after. If both are present, after is ignored.

after
string
Example: after=0

Offset returned results. This parameter conflicts with query. If both are present, this parameter is ignored.

Responses

/api/v3/groups/{slug}/members

Response samples

Content type

join a group

This operation joins an existing group, or causes another user to join a group. If the group is private and you are not an administrator, this method will cause that user to request membership, instead. For user invitations, you'll want to call POST /groups/{slug}/invites/{uid}.

path Parameters
slug
required
string
Example: test-group

slug of the group you would like to join

uid
required
number
Example: 1

uid of the user to join the group

Responses

/api/v3/groups/{slug}/membership/{uid}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "status": {
    • "code": "ok",
    • "message": "OK"
    },
  • "response": { }
}

rescind group ownership

This operation rescinds ownership privilege from a user. Note: Every group needs at least one owner, so if you are attempting to remove the last owner of a group, this call will fail.

path Parameters
slug
required
string
Example: test-group

get subcategories

This operation returns the requested category's children (aka subcategories).

It is important to note that the number of subcategories returned is dependent on the configured value for that category. If a lower number is specified than there are children, then the list will be truncated to that number.

This is defined by the subCategoriesPerPage key in the category's hash.

path Parameters
cid
required
string
Example: 1

a valid category id, 0 for global privileges, admin for admin privileges

string

string

string

The sorting method of topics

direction
string

The sorting of returned results (if you scroll up you want the topics reversed). Set to "-1" for reversed results.

update watch state

This operation changes the watch state for the category.

Note that a category can be watched, not watched, or ignored:

  • A category that is watched will have topics that show up in both /unread and /recent
  • A category that is not watched will have topics that show up in /recent but not /unread
  • A category that is ignored will not have topics that show up in either route.

This API call does not pertain to notifications for new topics in categories. That behaviour is handled by a third-party plugin — nodebb-plugin-category-notifications

Additionally, when a category's watch state is updated, all of that category's children also have their watch states updated.

path Parameters
cid
required
string
Example: 1

a valid category id

Request Body schema: application/json
required
uid
number

This value is optional, it allows privileged uids to use this call to affect other user accounts.

state
string
Enum: "watching" "notwatching" "ignoring"

Responses

/api/v3/categories/{cid}/watch

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "uid": 1,
  • "state": "watching"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "status": {
    • "code": "ok",
    • "message": "OK"
    },
  • "response": {
    • "modified": [
      • 0
      ]
    }
}

synchronize category

This operation requires an enabled activitypub integration

Establishes a "follow" relationship between another activitypub-enabled actor. Until an "accept" response is received, the synchronization will stay in a pending state. Upon acceptance, a one-way sync is achieved; the other actor will need to follow the same category in order to achieve full two-way synchronization.

path Parameters
cid
required
string
Example: 1

a valid category id

Request Body schema: application/json
required
actor
string

A valid actor uri or webfinger handle

Responses

/api/v3/categories/{cid}/follow

Request samples

  • Payload
Content type
application/json
{
  • "actor": "https://example.org/foobar"
}

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "status": {
    • "code": "ok",
    • "message": "OK"
    },
  • "response": { }
}

unsynchronize category

This operation requires an enabled activitypub integration

Removes a "follow" relationship between another activitypub-enabled actor. Unlike the synchronization request, this does not require an acceptance from the remote end.

N.B. This method only severs the link for incoming content.

topics

Topic-based calls (create, modify, delete, etc.)

create a new topic

This operation creates a new topic with a post. Topic creation without a post is not allowed via the Write API as it is an internal-only method.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
cid
required
number
title
required
string
content
required
string
timestamp
number

A UNIX timestamp of the topic's creation date (i.e. when it will be posted). Specifically, this value can only be set to a value in the future if the calling user has the topics:schedule privilege for the passed-in category. Otherwise, the current date and time are always assumed. In some scenarios (e.g. forum migrations), you may want to backdate topics and posts. Please see this Developer FAQ topic for more information.

tags
Array of strings

chats

Calls related to the user private messaging system

list recent chat rooms

This operation lists recently used chat rooms that the calling user is a part of

query Parameters
start
number
Example: start=20

The start index from which chat rooms will be displayed. e.g. start of 10 with perPage of 10 would result in the 10th to 19th chat rooms being returned

perPage
number
Example: perPage=20

The number of chat rooms to be displayed per page

page
number
Example: page=1

Deprecated — The page number. This parameter is supeceded by start, and will stop working in NodeBB v4.

Responses

/api/v3/chats/

query Parameters

string
Enum: "hours" "days"

Whether to display dashboard data segmented daily or hourly

number

A UNIX timestamp denoting the end of the analytics reporting period

count
number
Example: count=20

search

find categories by keyword

This operation returns a set of categories matching the keyword search.

A number of filtering options are available, and can be passed in via query string.

query Parameters
search
string
Example: search=announcements

The keyword used in the category search

query
string

Likely unused — a URI-encoded JSON string containing values that are passed to getRecentTopicReplies.

parentCid
Array of arrays
Example: parentCid=0

A list of category IDs. The values received are simply reflected back in the results. Matching cids will have "selected" set to true.

selectedCids
Array of arrays

Likely deprecated — the sorting method of topics (use categoryTopicSort instead.)

categoryTopicSort
string
Example: categoryTopicSort=newest_to_oldest

The sorting method of topics

direction
string
Example: direction=1

The sorting of returned results (if you scroll up you want the topics reversed). Set to "-1" for reversed results.

Responses

/api/v3/search/categories

Response samples

  • 200
Content type
application/json
{
  • "status": {
    • "code": "ok",
    • "message": "OK"
    },
  • "response": {
    • "categories": [
      • {
        • "cid": 0,
        • "name": "string",
        • "level": 0,
        • "icon": "fa-comments-o",
        • "bgColor": "string",
        • "color": "string",
        • "parentCid": 0,
        • "imageClass": "auto",
        • "selected": true
        }
      ]
    }
}
